mads_rules.rule: Each MADS record must have an authority element with at least one child element.
Variant forms of the authority (alternative names, spellings, etc.) should be included when identified.
Related authorities should be linked with appropriate relationship types.
Use appropriate xlink attributes when referencing external resources.
Include language and script information when applicable.
Record metadata about the MADS record itself in the recordInfo element.
Make educated inferences when complete information isn't available, but indicate uncertainty.
Prioritize authoritative sources for name forms when they can be determined.
When extracting from unstructured content, be conservative in what you claim as definitive.

CRITICAL: Always include ALL relevant MADS elements in the output, even if their content is empty or unknown. Use empty tags (e.g., <namePart type="date"/>) or placeholder text when information is not available rather than omitting the element entirely.
For required elements where no information is found, include the element with empty content or a placeholder like "Unknown" or "Not specified".
